result.execSummary:
The defendant Elizabeth E Sporra was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Keeping Place of Prostitution [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 944.34(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Provide a DNA sample (unless previously done) and PAY DNA surcharge.  PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.   The Court ordered that the court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
Credit given for ZERO days time served if revoked.

superMiscConds.notes: Complete a job training program to enhance ability to obtain legitimate employment.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm or body armor.
No contact with the co-actor, David Rhodes.

Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
Court advised defendant that her voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until her civil rights are restored.

Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.

records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (17 pages) commencing MAY 11, 2015 received and filed. kl

Defendant Elizabeth E Sporra in court with attorney Joseph R Kennedy.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State and defense.

AS TO COUNT 1:    Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 4 YEARS.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS. 
Credit given for ZERO days time served if revoked.

Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION (AS TO COUNT 1): 
* Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
* No contact with the co-actor, David Rhodes.
* Complete a job training program to enhance ability to obtain legitimate employment.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* Provide a DNA sample (unless previously done) and PAY DNA surcharge.  The Court ordered that the DNA surcharge restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.   The Court ordered that the court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that her voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until her civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.

Defendant Elizabeth E Sporra in court with attorney Joseph R Kennedy.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties unable to proceed with a sentencing hearing today.
Judge Donald is currently in trial on an unrelated matter.
Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 05-11-2015 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Sentencing Hearing.

Defendant Elizabeth E Sporra in court with attorney Joseph R Kennedy.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

This matter was originally scheduled for a Jury Trial today, however, the parties have now reached an agreement.

AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to her plea, advised of her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her rights.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised she is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised she is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

Case adjourned to 04-20-2015 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2. Judge Donald's Court for Sentencing.

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.

Defendant Elizabeth E Sporra in court with Attorney Maayan Silver for Attorney Ann T Bowe.  Defendant Elizabeth E Sporra in custody.  Timothy J Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

This matter was originally scheduled for a Plea Hearing today, however, the parties are unable to proceed.
The defendant and Atty. Bowe are having communication issues.
Atty. Bowe filed a motion to withdraw as counsel on 06-23-2014.
Statements made.
Court GRANTS Atty. Bowe's motion to withdraw as counsel for the defendant.
Atty. Ann Bowe is now discharged.
Atty. Bowe is to ensure new counsel is appointed for the defendant by the next court date.

Defendant Elizabeth E Sporra in court with attorney Ann T Bowe.  Defendant Elizabeth E Sporra in custody.  Timothy J Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Elizabeth E Sporra in court with attorney Ann T Bowe.  Defendant Elizabeth E Sporra in custody.  David A Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.
